sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词或短语动词均有"推延，延期"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: delay, postpone, defer, suspend, prolong, put off
means: delay ： 普通用词，多指因外界原因推迟或耽误，也可指有意推迟。
postpone ： 正式用词，语气较强，多指有安排的延期，常指明延期到一定的时间。
defer ： 正式用词，语气强于postpone，多指故意拖延。
suspend ： 指暂时中断以待某种条件的实现。
prolong ： 指把时间延长至超过正常或通常的限度。
put off ： 口语用词，与postpone同义，但较通俗。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词含有"伸展，延长"或"延伸"之意。
means: extend ： 指时间或空间的延长，也可指影响和使用范围等的扩大。
lengthen ： 指把长度或期限拉长或延长，其反义是shorten。
stretch ： 指长度的延伸以及宽度的增加。
prolong ： 通常指时间上延长得超过了一般或正常的限度。

sentence.Network_en: A long drawn out war would likely deepen and prolong the recession.
sentence.Network_cn: 一场旷日持久的战争很可能会使衰退程度加剧，时间延长。

sentence.Network_en: The operation could prolong his life by two or three years.
sentence.Network_cn: 这次手术可使他多活两三年。

sentence.Network_en: He has decided to prolong his visit through the weekend.
sentence.Network_cn: 他已决定把他的访问延长到过完周末.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French prolonguer, from late Latin prolongare, from pro- 'forward, onward' + longus 'long'

entry.def: To prolong something means to make it last longer.

example.ex: Mr Chesler said foreign military aid was prolonging the war...
example.tran: 切斯勒先生说国外的军事援助拉长了战事。

example.ex: The actual action of the drug can be prolonged significantly.
example.tran: 这种药物实际起作用的时间可以大大延长。

means.word_mean: 1. lengthen in time; cause to be or last longer;

sentences.sentence: "She extended her visit by another day"
"The meeting was drawn out until midnight"

means.word_mean: 2. lengthen or extend in duration or space;

sentences.sentence: "We sustained the diplomatic negociations as long as possible"

auth_sentence.content: Bones are thought to cure rheumatism and prolong life.
auth_sentence.res_content: Bones are thought to cure rheumatism and prolong life.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Bones are thought to cure rheumatism and prolong life.

auth_sentence.content: Yes, we could prolong our struggle and fight longer.
auth_sentence.res_content: Yes, we could prolong our struggle and fight longer.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Yes, we could prolong our struggle and fight longer.

auth_sentence.content: Cooking school seemed an easy way to prolong his visa.
auth_sentence.res_content: Cooking school seemed an easy way to prolong his visa.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Cooking school seemed an easy way to prolong his visa.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表示"赞同,亲…"; 2. 也有"代替"之意; 3. 表示"向前,在前;预先"; 4. 表示"很多…"

pro=pro向前,在前;预先+ig=act做→做在前面,做得多→大量的

pro很多…+flig打出+ate……的→把钱不断的打出去→挥霍的
pro很多…+fuse流→流很多→大量的
pro很多…+lif+ic……的→带来东西→多产的
pro很多…+sper希望+ous……的→希望很多→兴旺的
pro代替+louct说+or人→n. 议长;代言人
pro代替+noun名词→n.代名词
pro向前+blem抛→抛出问题
pro向前,在前;预先+cliv倾斜+ity表名词→向前倾斜
pro向前,在前;预先+fil线条+e→前面的线条
pro向前,在前;预先+gress走→向前走
pro向前,在前;预先+ject扔→扔向前面→投射;引申为工程项目
pro向前,在前;预先+logue说→在前面说→前言
pro向前,在前;预先+spect看→向前看→前景
pro很多…+fit=fic做→做很多→做得好→利润
pro向前,在前;预先+cure关心→关心在前→[想要]获得
pro向前,在前;预先+fess说→在前面说坦白
pro向前,在前;预先+ject扔→扔向前面→投射;引申为工程项目
pro向前,在前;预先+long长→向前拉长→延长
pro向前,在前;预先+mot动+e→向前动→促进
pro向前,在前;预先+pel推→向前推

pro很多…+crastin明天+ate表动词→有许多明天明日复明日→拖延
pro很多…+create创造→创造很多→生儿育女
pro很多…+lifer=fer带来+ate表动词→带来很多生命→繁殖

Sentence.sentence: Trees need more water as temperatures rise, but the prolonged droughts have robbed them of moisture, making whole forests easily cleared of trees and turned into farmland.

means.word_mean: 延长; 拉长; 拖延

sentences.en: Two countries prolonged signing an agreement until details could be agreed on.
sentences.cn: 两国推迟签约直到就细节达成协议。

jushi.english: The book fair has been prolonged due to some reason.
jushi.chinese: 由于某种原因，书展被延长了。

jushi.english: The ceremony will be prolonged by ten minutes.
Two countries prolonged signing an agreement until details could be agreed on.
jushi.chinese: 两国推迟签约直到就细节达成协议。
